description.en: This course focuses on security issues associated with the development and use of ICTs, the resulting problem area of 'cyber security' and relevant legal issues.
description.et: Kursus keskendub IKT arendamise ja kasutamisega seotud julgeoleku probleemidele, küberjulgeolekule ning teistele asjakohastele õiguslikele teemadele.

objectives.en: This course will address cross-border implications of development and uses of ICTs and the resulting security concerns. It will familiarize the students with international law applicable to cross-border cyber conflict and discuss national security and defence aspects of ICTs. The students will learn to understand how uses of ICTs affect international security and how to resolve relevant issues under international law and policy.
objectives.et: Kursuse raames analüüsitakse IKT arendamise ja kasutamisega kaasnevaid riikliku ja rahvusvahelise julgeoleku probleeme. Kursuse raames õpitakse kohaldama rahvusvahelist õigust küberkonfliktidele. Tudengid õpivad mõistma IKT mõju rahvusvahelisele julgeolekule ja IKT kasutamisega seonduvate julgeolekuprobleemide lahendamist siseriiklikus ja rahvusvahelise õiguses ja poliitikas.

learning_outcomes.en: The students will be able to critically analyse the legal implications of global trends in the development and uses of ICTs; know the main trends related to politically motivated cyber-attacks and their legal implications, including the applicability of the law of armed conflict, state responsibility, and countermeasures; be able to construct legal strategies for mitigation of political cyber risk and be able to legally evaluate ICT related threats to public safety, national security, and international peace and security.
learning_outcomes.et: Üliõpilased õpivad mõistma IKT kasutamisega kaasnevaid rahvusvahelise julgeoleku probleeme, poliitilise taustaga küberrünnete trende ning küberjulgeolekuintsidentide lahendamist rahvusvahelise õiguse pinnalt. Üliõpilased oskavad koostada strateegiaid poliitilise küberriski maandamiseks õiguslike vahenditega; eristada rahvusvahelise küberjulgeoleku problemaatika infotehnoloogilisi, poliitilisi ja õiguslikke aspekte ning leida õiguslikke lahendusi erinevatele küberjulgeoleku probleemidele.

independent_work.et:
Independent work will comprise of a background memo, a memorial and an answer to a counter-memorial. As the course will end in an ICJ style moot court, the independent work during the duration of the course will support the preparation for the moot court.

The Students will prepare a background memo based on the cyber security related case to be analysed in the moot court. The background memo (1-2 pages) will map out the facts, problems and main questions of the case. Deadline: TBA. The background memo must be uploaded to Moodle.

In the memorandum (5-7 pages), the Students present the facts of the case, their arguments and analysis of the case for the applicant or respondent respectively. The analysis will have to take into account the technical, legal as well as socio-political aspects of the case. Students will provide case law and State practice examples to argue their case. Students are expected to attach a bibliography to their memorandum. Deadline: TBA. The memorandum must be uploaded to Moodle.

For the answer to the counter-memorandum (4-5 pages), the Students will be provided with the memoranda of the opposite side and they will analyse and rebut other side's arguments. Students are expected to attach a bibliography to their answer. Deadline: TBA. The answer to the counter-memorandum must be uploaded to Moodle.

Throughout the semester, Students will get feedback on their progress to help them to prepare for the moot court.

In the beginning of the course, the students can choose whether they want to act as an Applicant, Respondent or Judge. If the Student wishes to be in the role of the Judge, he or she will also have to write background memo weighing the arguments and problems of both sides of the case. He or she will not have to write a memorandum nor an answer to the counter-memorandum. However, the Student will have to write a judgment delivering a verdict, weighing the facts, the arguments and provide an analytical account of his/her decision process. Length of the analysis is 9-12 pages. The deadline for the judgment: TBA.

All written works must follow the Writing and Formatting Guideline of University of Tartu (e.g. 12 pt, line spacing 1.5, footnotes etc.).

Overdue work will not be accepted. Detailed description of the task will be uploaded to SIS under Study Materials.

ICJ style moot court will take place on TBA. Before the Students can take part of the moot court, they must have submitted the background memo, the memorandum and the answer to a counter-memorandum. The students will be assigned to teams of applicant, respondent and judge. The moot court will allow both sides to present their arguments. Then both sides are given a chance for a rebuttal and closing arguments. During the whole process, the panel of judges are allowed to ask questions. After the moot court, the Student who chose to assume the role of the Judge will deliver a verdict and an analysis of both side's arguments. The judgments will be distributed among Students.

grade_evaluation.et:
Timely and satisfactory submission and positive outcome of the background memo, memorandum and answer to counter-memorandum as well as participation in the moot court. Positive result means that the Student has received at least 50% of the points for the given task.

The course grade will be comprised of four parts:
Background memo - 15%
Memorial - 30%
Answer to counter-memorial - 20%
Moot Court - 35%

91-100% results in the grade A
81-90% results in the grade B
71-80% results in the grade C
61-70% results in the grade D
51-60% results in the grade E
0-50% results in the grade F

debt_elimination.et:
According to the Study Regulations (Õppekorralduseeskiri). Overdue work will not be accepted.

If it happens that a Student falls ill or can provide evidence of other unexpected circumstances that result in the Student not being able to take part of the moot court, he or she will automatically be assigned the role of the Judge. As a Judge, he or she will be provided with two memorials and must write a judgment, delivering a verdict, weighing the facts, the arguments and provide an analytical account of his/her decision process. Length of the judgment is 9-12 pages. Deadline for the judgment is TBA.
